I think for the most part, the majority of members appreciate the hard, unpaid work the staff here do and we don't expect to please 100% of the people. There's always someone that's going to cry over something.

Cheers!

You know, if you do it right then generally the maximum number of people will be complaining. If you aren't favouring one point of view over another then both sides will complain of "bias", compared to if you were actually being bias, in which case only one side will accuse you of bias. This goes for almost everything, whether it be multiplayer game balance, moderator performance, etc. It's actually quite amusing to see the same pattern repeated so many times over (although to what degree people complain varies with the sort of userbase a community attracts, either way though it can be difficult to gauge how happy the community really is - you can't hear people not-complaining after all). It's surprising the number of websites with moderators who are apparently both nazis and also part of the liberal conspiracy.

Anyway, I haven't seen anything too alarming with regards to the regulations here. And so that I'm not totally off-topic, I've been recommending KSP to everyone I can, one person has bought it as a result and others I think are considering it. It's a great game, so yeah, I'll keep promoting it where I can.
